questions.text: Who gave Psychosocial stages of development?
Most important in initial interview of a psychiatric patient: (**)

options.label: C
options.text: Refer to the patient by his/her name from the beginning

options.label: D
options.text: Ask about any emotional trauma in childhood

questions.correct_answer: A. Not to ask leading questions

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in "purposes of classification in psychiatry"?
Which of the following statements is not true about “affect”?

options.label: A
options.text: Pervasive and sustained state of emotion that colours the person’s perception of the world

options.label: C
options.text: External and outward expression of emotion

questions.correct_answer: A. Pervasive and sustained state of emotion that colours the person’s perception of the world

questions.text: Which of the following is not a disorder of form of thought?

A 45 year old man presents to psychiatry OPD with complaints of “TICKLING” sensation over his abdomen with a referral note from surgeon and dermatologist of unable to find any specific cause for the same despite all necessary investigations and procedures. On Mental status examination, he expresses that others cant feel it, only he can, because there is small little naughty angel sitting in his abdomen, which when jumps inside, patient gets the sensation. Identify the symptom?
Healthy thinking includes all except?
"VORBEIREDEN" term is synonymous with all except:
On hearing the sound of tap water, a patient experiences hearing of voices scolding him. This phenomenon is known as:
Which of the following feature present in "psychosis" best differentiates it from "neurosis"?
Term "Demence precoce" was coined by:

22 years old Babu had fight with his neighbour’s son. Next day, which going to the bus stop, he left that 2 uniformed policemen were following him. On reaching home he was frightened and he felt that the neighbours were using radio waves to control his mind. What is his symptom:
In which subtype of schizophrenia grimacing is a feature:
All are true about simple schizophrenia except:

options.label: B
options.text: Minimum duration needed to diagnose is 1 year

questions.text: All are features of catatonia except:
Which of the following personality subtype is more prone to develop “folia-a-deux”?
All of the following are true about "Late onset schizophrenia" except:
questions.correct_answer: B. Onset after 40 y of age

questions.text: “Pseudocommunity” is seen in :-
All are good prognostic indicators of schizophrenia except:
Antipsychotic proven to be most beneficial in treatment resistant schizophrenia?
The following person shown in the figure, can maintain this posture for a long period of time. What is the most effective first line treatment for this patient.
All are true regarding epidemiology of mood disorder except:

options.label: A
options.text: The mean age of onset of major depressive disorder is 40 years

options.label: B
options.text: BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid cyclers are more common in women than men

options.label: D
options.text: Depression is more common in rural areas

questions.correct_answer: B. BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

questions.text: True regarding "neurotransmitters" in mood disorders are all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Dopamine activity is decreased in depression and increased in mania

options.label: B
options.text: Cholinergic agonists can exacerbate symptoms in depression and can reduce symptoms in mania

options.label: C
options.text: Reduction in levels of GABA has been observed in plasma, CSF in c/o depression

options.label: D
options.text: Glutamate activity is decreased in depression.

questions.correct_answer: D. Glutamate activity is decreased in depression.

questions.text: All are true about "recurrent depression" except:

options.label: A
options.text: To call depression as "recurrent", minimum no of episodes required are 3

options.label: B
options.text: 2 episodes of depression must be separated by an intervening normal period of at least 2 months

options.label: C
options.text: Mood stablizers proven to be very effective in recurrent depression is lamotrigine

options.label: D
options.text: Above 3 statements are all true and none is false

questions.correct_answer: A. To call depression as "recurrent", minimum no of episodes required are 3

questions.text: The phenomenon of thinking where the affected person tends to draw a specific conclusion without sufficient evidence is known as:
Post partum depression is diagnosed when onset of symptoms occur with in ________ weeks/months post partum?
All are true about "atypical depression" except:

options.label: D
options.text: More frequent comorbid diagnosis of panic disorder as compared to with typical major depressive disorder,

questions.text: All of following are clinical features seen in an episode of depression that are predictive of bipolarity except:

options.label: D
options.text: Rapid onset and offset of depressive episodes of short duration (<3 months)

questions.correct_answer: B. Depression with marked psychomotor agitation

questions.text: Anti manic response of valproate is associated with a serum levels of valproate as:
Which of the following objective signs of depression is shown in figure:
Term "Briquet syndrome" has been later replaced by:
Which one of following characteristically differentiates "facticious disorder" from "malingering"?

Vasanthi 45 years was brought to casually with abnormal movement which included persistent deviation of neck to right side one day before she was prescribed Haloperidol 5 mgs three times daily from the psychiatry OPD. She also had an altercation with her husband recently, which of the following is the most likely cause for her symptoms:
All are included in “Obsessive compulsive and related disorders” in DSM-5 except?
Which of the following is newly added dimension in the diagnosis of post traumatic stress disorder, in dsm 5? (**)

options.label: A
options.text: Sleep disturbance and difficulty in concentration

options.label: C
options.text: Avoidance of stimuli associated with stressful events

options.label: D
options.text: Negative alterations in cognition and mood

questions.correct_answer: D. Negative alterations in cognition and mood

questions.text: A 35 year old male was found by the police wandering in the city. He was unable to give information on his home address or other family members. He appeared to be well groomed, and would be able to converse with others. On examination, there was no major medical illness or presence of psychotic symptoms. Urine screening revealed negative for any psychoactive substances. Most likely diagnosis is:

A 22-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital because of right-hand anesthesia that developed after an argument with her brother. She is in good spirits and seems unconcerned about her problem. There is no history of physical trauma. The neurologic examination is negative except for reduced sensitivity to pain in a glove-like distribution over the right hand. Her entire family is in attendance and is expressing great concern and attentiveness. She ignores her brother and seems unaware of the chronic jealousy and rivalry described by her family. The patient’s enjoyment of the attention and concern of her family is most likely due to:
Vasovagal symptoms of bradycardia, dizziness and headache are seen in phobia of? (*)

A 31 year old male, with mood disorder, on 30 mg of Haloperidol and 1000 mg of lithium, is brought to the hospital emergency room with history of acute onset of fever, excessive sweating, confusion, rigidity of limbs and decreased communication for a day. Examination reveals tachycardia and labile blood pressure and investigations reveal increased CPK enzyme levels and leucocytosis. He is likely to have developed: (**)
Which of the following is an “illusion”? (*)
All of the following tests are used to test “Attention and concentration” except? (**)

options.label: C
options.text: Telling days of week in reverse order

questions.text: A person presents to psychiatry OPD with pain at multiple sites, associated with weakness, low mood, decreased enjoyment, always worried about his illness, saying that all problem he has is due to a “medical condition” which is not treated well yet, what is his level of INSIGHT? (**)

A previously healthy 60-year-old man undergoes a corneal transplant. Three months later, he is profoundly demented, demonstrates myoclonic jerks on examination, and has an EEG that shows periodic bursts of electrical activity superimposed on a slow background. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 69-year-old man with a diagnosis of delirium has symptoms of psychosis which include: frightening auditory and visual hallucinations and paranoid delusions. Which of the following medications should be chosen first for this man’s symptoms?

A 23-year-old man comes to the physician with the complaint that his memory has worsened over the past 2 months and that he has difficulty concentrating. He has lost interest in his friends and his work. He has difficulty with abstract thoughts and problem solving. He has also felt depressed. MRI scan shows parenchymal abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Antipsychotics to be used with caution in:

A 19-year-old man is brought to the emergency room by his distraught parents, who are worried about his vomiting and profuse diarrhea. On arrival, his pupils are dilated, his blood pressure is 175/105 mm Hg, and his muscles are twitching. His parents report that these symptoms started 2 hours earlier. For the past few days he has been homebound because of a sprained ankle, and during this time he has been increasingly anxious and restless. He has been yawning incessantly and has had a runny nose. Which of the following drugs is this man most likely to be withdrawing from?

A 35-year-old man stumbles into the emergency room. His pulse is 100 beats per minute, his blood pressure is 170/95 mm Hg, and he is diaphoretic. He is tremulous and has difficulty relating a history. He does admit to insomnia the past two nights and sees spiders walking on the walls. He has been a drinker since age 19, but has not had a drink in 3 days. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Formication and delusion of persecution occurs together in -

A 65-year-old woman with a history of prolonged alcohol abuse cheerfully greets the resident doctor of her nursing home, whom she has met many times before, and calls him “my dear friend Jack.” The physician explains who he is and tells the patient his name. Two minutes later, when he asks the patient if she knows who he is, she answers with a smile: “Of course, you are my cousin Anthony from New Jersey.” What vitamin deficiency can cause this particular form of alcohol induced amnestic disorder?
An adoloscent whose chronological age was 18y, mental age was corresponding to 12y, ; according to binet formula for I.Q. calculation, he should be (as per DSM grading)
All of the following are included under medical complications seen in anorexia nervosa except?

A 4-year-old girl is brought to her pediatrician because her parents think she does not seem to be “developing normally.” The girl’s mother states that her daughter seemed normal for at least the first 2 to 3 years of her life. She was walking and beginning to speak in sentences. She was able to play with her mother and older sister. The mother has been noticing that over the past 2 months her daughter has lost these previously acquired abilities. She will no longer play with anyone else and has stopped speaking entirely. She has lost all bowel control, when previously she had not needed a diaper for at least a year. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 12-year-old boy is brought to the psychiatrist because his mother says the boy is driving her “nuts.” She reports that he constantly argues with her and his father, does not follow any of the house rules, and incessantly teases his sister. She says that he is spiteful and vindictive and loses his temper easily. Once he is mad, he stays that way for long periods of time. The mother notes that the boy started this behavior only about 1 year previously. While she states that this behaviour started at home, it has now spread to school, where his grades are dropping because he refuses to participate. The patient maintains that none of this is his fault––his parents are simply being unreasonable. He denies feeling depressed and notes that he sleeps well through the night. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Anorexia nervosa can be differentiated from bullimia nervosa by:
questions.correct_answer: D. Peculiar pattern of food handling

questions.text: The following differentiates "binge eating disorder" from bullimia nervosa?

options.label: B
options.text: A sense of lack of control over eating during the episode

options.label: D
options.text: Not associated with use of inappropriate compensatory behaviour

questions.correct_answer: D. Not associated with use of inappropriate compensatory behaviour

questions.text: Bruxism is seen in :

30 year old gentleman has excessive sleep at work attributed to sleep discomfort at night. He also has recent history of falling while partying with friends. Other features that can be seen associated with this condition are all except?

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of function of neuropeptide OREXIN

options.label: D
options.text: Paralysis with sleep awake junction hallucinations

questions.text: All are true about “alcoholic blackouts” except? (AIIMS)

options.label: A
options.text: It is a discrete episode of anterograde amnesia

options.label: D
options.text: Remote memory is relatively intact during the blackout

questions.correct_answer: C. Person appears confused to onlookers

questions.text: Theory of suicide is given by:

A 42-year-old man comes to the psychiatrist at the insistence of his boss because he constantly misses important deadlines. The man states that everyone at work is lazy and that no one lives up to his own standards for perfection. He is angry when the physician starts the interview 3 minutes later than the appointed time. He notes that he is always fighting with his wife because he is a “pack rat” and is unable to throw anything out. During the interview, he appears very rigid and stubborn.
Most common sexual disorder in males?

An attractive and well-dressed 22-year-old woman is arrested for prostitution, but on being booked at the jail, she is found to actually be a male. The patient tells the consulting physician that he is a female trapped in a male body and he has felt that way since he was a child. He has been taking female hormones and is attempting to find a surgeon who would remove his male genitals and create a vagina. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not true regarding topographical model of mind, given by sigmund freud?

options.label: C
options.text: Ego has all 3 components, unconcious, preconcious and concious

questions.correct_answer: D. Defence mechanisms are completely unconcious

questions.text: Which of the following is a mature defense mechanism?
Picasso syndrome (painter’s obsession developed into artistic painting ) Ego defense mechanism is :
Oedipus complex is seen in :
questions.correct_answer: C. Boys of 3-5 years of age

questions.text: Fixation of Hysteria is :-

Mohan, a 7-year old boy, does not like to eat green vegetables. In order to encourage him to eat green vegetables, his mother would offer him a piece of his favourite chocolate, every time he would finish his green vegetables. Such a type of behaviour change is based on which of the following paradigms?
Acc to jean piaget, cognitive developmental theory, concepts like "out of sight is out of mind" and "here and now" are seen in which of the following stages :
Image shown belongs to which test:
Image shown in this question is a of which type of test:
Test used for organic brain syndrome is:
Cognitive remediation refers to –
A man was asked to draw a clock, and the following figure shows his drawing: (AIPG) Neurotransmitter involved in the disease with which man is suffering from is:
21 yr old boy with no family history of schizophrenia is well controlled on risperidone for past 2 months, minimum for how long it should be continued?
Most common extrapyramidal side effect?
Most common side effect of clozapine?
Weight gain due to antipsychotics is due to its action on which receptors? (*)
Cause of death in neuroleptic malignant syndrome? (*)

A middle aged man suddenly becomes detached, and starts writing poems and stories, although it couldn’t be understood by anyone because of language and context was also not rational. Most probable diagnosis? (*)
Response to treatment in schizophrenia is predicted by: (*)
Most peculiar alteration in sleep neurophysiology in depression is? (**)

options.label: A
options.text: Nocturnal awakenings and early morning awakening

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in total duration of REM sleep

questions.text: Antidepressant used in smoking cessation?
A patient suffering from bipolar disorder, getting episodes of mania and depression, because of poor compliance to drugs, psychotherapy of choice? (***)
Which neurotransmitter levels are found to be decreased in “Delirium”? (*)
Morbid jealousy is caused by excessive use of? (*)

12 year old girl has a history of 1 year of constant grammatical mistakes and spelling errors. But her performance in other subjects is average, she performs good in oral assesment and there is no difficulty in reading. Most probable diagnosis? (*)

A female of 23 years of age has come to emergency after suicidal cut of wrist, history of break up with boyfriend, similar history in past of such attempts. There is no history of depression. She behaves very rudely with nurse but when she was attended by handsome male resident doctor, she talked sweetly. Most Probable diagnosis? (*)
All are true about “Electroconvulsive therapy” except? (**)

options.label: A
options.text: After ECT, CSF levels of BDNF increase

options.label: D
options.text: For a seizure to be effective in the course of ECT, it should last for at least 25 seconds.

questions.correct_answer: B. Anterograde amnesia resolves in 1-2 days

questions.text: In which of the following “Culture bound syndromes”, person presents with acute anxiety and fear of death associated with disappearance of genitalia? (**)
The column 3 of polysomnography set in the given image corresponds to which stage?
A 30-year-old male was diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder and was prescribed on Tablet Escitalopram 10 mg Once Daily dosage. Most common long term side effect is:
A 35-year-old male who is a known case of psychosis on regular treatment, developed disturbed vision. On examination, it revealed retinal pigments. The most probable causative agent is:
A 25-year-old male was brought to the ER with aggressive behaviour, disinhibition and irritability following a traumatic brain injury. The likely lobe involved in injury is

A 37-year-old female presented to the OPD with complains of sensations of current passing through her body, which is controlled by her neighbours through a chip inserted in her brain and heart since 4 years. The daughter reports of patient talking to self and gesticulating. The mechanism responsible for above condition is

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased DA in Dorsolateral mesocortical pathway

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased DA in venteromedial mesocortical pathway

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased DA in mesolimbic pathway

questions.text: A 20-year-old male who is having 60% intellectual disability, is brought to the OPD with talking to self, gesticulating and suspiciousness since 7 months. The most probable diagnosis is

A 30-year-old male was brought by his 3 months pregnant wife to the medicine OPD with complains of abdominal pain, craving for food, nausea and vomiting, weight gain, generalized aches. All the investigations are normal. The most probable diagnosis is:
A 25-year-old male was diagnosed to have BPAD in mania and was prescribed on Tab Lithium 450mg 1-0-1. After how many days, will you check for Serum Lithium levels?

A 22-year-old female, who is a known case of GAD, presented to Emergency Room, with complaints of sudden onset apprehension and uncomfortable feeling of impending doom. The preferred drug for the patient in emergency is:
